column2: Which of the following palettes do you most associate with levels from easy to difficult?
column3: Would you prefer another scale, not listed here? If yes, describe it as accurately as possible.
I prefer the green-red scale, but with yellow inbetween (to indicate medium difficulty)
Just numbers from 1 to 10 indicating from easy to difficult
From green to orange to red
I think I would prefer a scale without a white stripe in the middle but with a smooth transition from one color to the other.
Cyan to Red would also be appropriate. Cyan is easy on the eyes and has a calming effect while red demands attention and caution.
No
No
n/a - colour system works for me!
No
white as the easiest till dark red as the hardest
White to black linear gradient
green<->red without white in the middle (i.e. bleeding from green into yellow, then orange, then red)
I would prefer something like the color maps under "sequentially uniform color maps" here: https://matplotlib.org/stable/tutorials/colors/colormaps.html
Yellow to blue
green-yellow-red
